file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 32-10-09-04 - TRAILING ARM CARDAN OF THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TRAILING ARM CARDAN OF THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the trailing arm cardan of the main landing gear. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY TRAILING ARM CARDAN OF THE MAIN ALL 32-10-09-000-801-A LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL TRAILING ARM CARDAN OF THE MAIN ALL 32-10-09-400-801-A LANDING GEAR - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 32-10-09 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-10-09-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. TRAILING ARM CARDAN OF THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the trailing arm cardan of the main landing gear. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION (TASK 52-12-02-000-801-A) - AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-801-A/200 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200 LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL WHEEL ASSEMBLY OF THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - AMM TASK 32-49-02-000-801-A/400 REMOVAL BRAKE ASSEMBLY OF THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - AMM TASK 32-49-03-000-801-A/400 REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To support the trailing arm of the landing GSE 003 Jack gear E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task RH of LH Main Landing Gear 1 Helps the other technician RH or LH Main Landing Gear EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-10-09 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open, safety and tag (DO NOT CLOSE) the ELEC PUMP 1 circuit breaker. (2) Make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system 1 is fully released AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200. (3) Make sure that the safety pins of the landing gears are installed AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200. (4) Lift the aircraft on jacks until the wheels are off the ground. AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-801-A/200. (5) Put GSE 003 under the trailing arm to support it. (6) Release the pressure from the MLG Pax- Door ACCUM (TASK 52-12-02-000-801-A). (7) Remove the MLG wheels AMM TASK 32-49-02-000-801-A/400. (8) Remove the MLG brakes AMM TASK 32-49-03-000-801-A/400. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A CAUTION:WITH THE TRAILING ARM DISCONNECTED FROM THE SHOCK ABSORBER, DO NOT LIFT THE AIRCRAFT TO MORE THAN THE OFF-THE- GROUND CONDITION, IN I. PREPARATION, ITEM (4). IF YOU DO NOT OBEY THIS, DAMAGE WILL OCCUR TO THE METALLIC TARGET OF THE LOWER AIR/GROUND PROXIMITY SWITCH, WHEN THE TRAILING ARM IS MOVED TO THE VERTICAL POSITION. (1) To remove the cardan (12), do as follows: (a) Release the cardan (12) from the lower end of the shock absorber (14) as follows: 1 Remove the cotter pin (5), the nut (4), the washer (3), the guide assembly (2), and the special bolt (1). (b) Release the cardan (12) from the lower end of the trailing arm (13) as follows: 1 Remove the cotter pin (6), the nut (7), the washer (8), the cap (9), the pivot (10), and the bolt (11). (c) Hold the shock absorber (14) and lower the trailing arm (13). For this, slowly operate GSE 003. (d) Remove the cardan (12). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-10-09 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Trailing Arm Cardan of the Main Landing Gear - Removal/Installation Figure 401 SHOCK ABSORBER B A ZONES 721 2 731 TRAILING ARM 6 1. SPECIAL BOLT 3 2. GUIDE ASSEMBLY 3. WASHER 4. NUT 5. COTTER PIN 14. SHOCK 4 ABSORBER 2. GUIDE ASSEMBLY 3. WASHER DET. A 13. TRAILING 7 4. NUT ARM 5. COTTER PIN 12. CARDAN 6. COTTER PIN 5 7. NUT 8. WASHER 1 9. CAP 2 DET. B 1 APPLY CA-1000. 2 PR1826B2ALO. 3 PRE-MOD SB 145-32-0059. 1 2 10. PIVOT 4 POST-MOD SB 145-32-0059. 11. BOLT 5 TORQUE: 5 TO 6.5 N.m (44 TO 57 lb.in) 6 APPLY CA-1000 OR COR-BAN 27 L. 7 TORQUE: 150 N.m (1328 lb.in) MAXIMUM EM145AMM320497C.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-10-09 Page 4 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-10-09-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. TRAILING ARM CARDAN OF THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the trailing arm cardan of the main landing gear. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-802-A/200 - LANDING GEAR AND MAIN DOOR ACCUMULATOR - AMM TASK 12-13-06-600-801-A/300 CHARGE EXTENSION AND RETRACTION SYSTEM - OPERA- AMM TASK 32-30-00-700-801-A/500 TIONAL CHECK LG EMERGENCY EXTENSION - OPERATIONAL AND AMM TASK 32-34-00-700-801-A/500 FUNCTIONAL CHECKS WHEEL ASSEMBLY OF THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - AMM TASK 32-49-02-400-801-A/400 INSTALLATION BRAKE ASSEMBLY OF THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - AMM TASK 32-49-03-400-801-A/400 INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To support the trailing arm of the landing GSE 003 Jack gear E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, For protection of the hands 2 available Fluid-Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- For protection of the eyes 2 available Base, Fluid-Resistant F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MEP09-075 Corrosion Inhibitive Sealant CA-1000 or COR-BAN 27 L AR SAE AMS 3277, Type I, Class B2 Sealant PR1826B2ALO AR MS 24665-134 Cotter Pin 1 MS 24665-362 Cotter Pin 2 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-10-09 Page 5 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task RH or LH Main Landing Gear 1 Helps the other technician RH or LH Main Landing Gear I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: DO NOT GET CA-1000 IN YOUR MOUTH OR EYES, OR ON YOUR SKIN. DO NOT BREATHE THE FUMES FROM CA-1000. PUT ON A PROTECTIVE SPLASH GOGGLE AND GLOVES WHEN YOU USE CA-1000. CA-1000 IS A TOXIC MATERIAL. (1) Apply corrosion inhibitive sealant CA-1000 on the pivot (10) and on the cap (9). Install the pivot (10), the bolt (11), the cap (9), the washer (8) and the nut (7) to attach the cardan (12) to the trailing arm (13). (2) Apply a torque of 5 to 6.5 N.m (44 to 57 lb.in) on the nut (7). (3) Install the cotter pin (6). (4) Apply a continuous bead of sealant PR1826B2ALO along the interface of the pivot (10) and the cap (9). NOTE: Sealant P/S 870B-2 or sealant AC-665 B-2 can be used as alternatives to sealant PR1826B2ALO. But, 24 hours after the application of these alternative sealants, a layer of varnish 683-3-2/X-310A must be applied to them. (5) Slowly operate GSE 003 to lift and install the cardan (12) to the shock absorber (14). (6) Apply CA-1000 or COR-BAN 27 L on the special bolt (1). Install the special bolt (1), the guide assembly (2), the washer (3) and the nut (4) to attach the cardan (12) to the lower end of the shock absorber (14). (7) Tighten and align the slot of nut (4) with the hole of bolt (1). Refer to (Figure 401). (8) Install the cotter pin (5). (9) Apply a continuous bead of sealant PR1826B2ALO along the interface of the special bolt (1). NOTE: Sealant P/S 870B-2 or sealant AC-665 B-2 can be used as alternatives to sealant PR1826B2ALO. But, 24 hours after the application of these alternative sealants, a layer of varnish 683-3-2/X-310A must be applied to them. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Lower GSE 003 and remove it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-10-09 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Install the MLG brakes AMM TASK 32-49-03-400-801-A/400. (3) Install the MLG wheels AMM TASK 32-49-02-400-801-A/400. (4) Pressurize the MLG Pax- Door ACCUM AMM TASK 12-13-06-600-801-A/300. (5) On the circuit breaker panel, remove the safety device, untag, and close the ELEC PUMP circuit breaker, as applicable. (6) Energize the aircraft. (7) Remove the safety pins from the landing gears. (8) Do an operational check of the MLG AMM TASK 32-30-00-700-801-A/500. (9) Do the landing gear functional check AMM TASK 32-34-00-700-801-A/500. (10) Do the functional check of the landing gear free-fall system AMM TASK 32-30-00-700-801-A/500. (11) Lower the aircraft and remove the jacks AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-802-A/200. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-10-09 Page 7 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
